channel.title: Gameboy-like device
channel.description:
I'm thinking about making a Gameboy type device, and I come here to ask your opinion/experience. Note that this is going to be a project I will be working on in my off time for what I'm expecting to be at least a year. It will probably be as long before I have a working prototype.
Some features that I plan on including are: micro/SD card for persistent storage Compatibility for all Gameboy cartridges Ability to import cartridge ROM to SD card (so you can play without the cartridge) Ability to transfer save data from SD card to cartridge and vice-versa (so you can play in the device / with cartridge without losing data) Multiple save files supported (for example; 5 Pokemon Red games saved)
As I said, this is a sizable project and it will likely be at least a year before I get something that boots.
If you have any experience / opinions on designing this, feel free to contribute. I have some documents explaining the cartridge layout and instruction sets, and there's plenty of documentation online.

item.title: Gameboy-like device
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:4, topic:417572”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=520126.msg3776917#msg3776917 date=1318164506]

Taking a Gameboy and modifying it? Or building your own?

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Game_Boy_line#Cartridges And yikes you have quite a bit of backwards compatibility to deal with

Building my own device. Although, I’ll probably end up using a screen similar in size to the GBA.

And it’s not a whole lot of backwards compatibility. It’s just the 3 generations (GB, GBC, GBA), unless they used a different format for the Gameboy Lite?
[/quote]

GB vs GBC are on two different architectures afaik, and i’m not sure about the GBA, but I still wish you luck[/quote]

The GB and GBC both use a custom processer, but is largely based on the Z80. There have been some instructions added and removed. The GBA on the other hand uses a standard ARM7.

Because of this, I will probably end up using an ARM7 as the physical processor, and emulate the Z80 (due to the changes Nintendo made to it).
